bind.jr:constraintMsg: 'Not observed' can only be selected by itself
'Not observed' can only be selected by itself
'Not done' can only be selected by itself
'Not adhered' can only be selected by itself

text.value: Pre-test: Establishing Relationship and Supportive Environment
Check if HIV testing items are working properly (check expiration date)
Uses culturally appropriate greeting gestures that convey respect and caring.
Provides comfortable, trusting atmosphere for patients to ask questions and responds to questions and concerns appropriately throughout the testing/counseling session.
Addresses primary concerns based on the what brought the person's to health facility
Addresses what brought person to health facility
Did the trainee mention clinical and prevention benefit of HIV testing at individual level
Did the trainee explain about services that are available for HIV Negative and Positive including availability of CTC
Did trainee explain significance of a "window period" in relationship to possible HIV test results?
Did trainee allows person to ask questions
Observe how verbal consent is obtained non-cohesively from client.
Observe how written consent from parents or guardian for children's or person with disabilities (as started in NACP consent forms) is obtained.
Are HIV test kits and supplies necessary for performing test are in place according to National Testing Algorithm?
HIV test kits and supplies in place
Did the trainee adhere to Lab SOP for performing rapid HIV testing to National Testing Algorithm?
Did the trainee interpret HIV test results and make use of the national testing algorithm?
Observe adherence to safe work practices at the site
Look for availability of sharps disposal (safety boxes)
Did trainee assess person's readiness to receive HIV results through questions, signs of emotional reactions etc?
Did the trainee remind the person what are the possible HIV results and their implications
Reminded of possible results and implications
Give the HIV results in a simple and clear language
Give the person time to reflect on HIV results
Explain the person that HIV was not detected at this time; however, since the person could be in the window period, recommends a second test after 3 months time.
Explained negative result, window period, and retest
Did the trainee remind person on prevention strategies
Did trainee explain to a person on the importance of notifying partner and to bring partner(s) in for HIV testing?
Importance of notifying partner; partner testing
Had trainee reminds person on difference between HIV-infection and having AIDS
Had trainee reminds person of the need for safe sex to prevent increased risk to self or to others e.g. condoms for all sexual intercourse.
Did the trainee explain to a person clearly the referral to CTC and services that are available at CTC?
Did trainee explain to a person on the importance of disclosure to partner and to bring partner(s) in for HIV testing?
Did the trainee assist the person to make disclosure plans to partner/ guardian/friends/relative?
Did the trainee give information about what to eat and stay healthy.
Is the client given information about community support groups and other services?
Observe if referral form was properly filled
Trainer/supervisor review daily registers and give feedback on areas that need improvement.
Trainer/supervisor reviews registers and gives feedback
What was the result of the HIV test?
Done, and form filled out correctly
Done, but form not filled out correctly
Being faithful to one partner uninfected
Positioning of the hand and finger
Supplies for specimen collection in place
